item.title: Countries: Gotta catch 'em all
item.description: Created with mapchart.net As an avid motorcycle enthusiast, I’ve had the privilege of riding through various landscapes, each offering its unique charm. Here’s a glimpse of my journey through eight countries, each experienced from the perspective of my trusty MT09 and T7. Belgium: An Urban Ride (MT09) My ride through Belgium felt like a continuous drive through a bustling city. Perhaps I missed a turn somewhere but it was quite the urban experience.

item.title: Chasing autumn: a farewell to the season
item.description: As the chill of autumn started to creep in, I convinced my friend Kim to embark on a farewell ride to the season. Our rendezvous point was the local gas station at 10:00 am on a crisp Sunday morning. We charted our course, and with the hum of our engines beneath us, we set off. The journey to our destination was a reminder that winter was knocking at the door - the cold was penetrating.

item.title: The Old Road to Vivestad
Mykle: A Cold Night's Adventure
item.description: Chasing the Hammock Dreams: A Cold Night’s Adventure A sudden urge overcame me â€“ the need to escape to nature and slumber beneath the stars in my trusty hammock. These cravings for outdoor solitude strike every now and then, and this time, I had a particular place in mind: a serene lake known as Mykle . My hope was to discover uncharted gravel roads and bask in the thrill of the unknown.

item.title: Learning the Ropes of Off-Road Riding
item.description: Image taken by Kim Kanten Setting Off on a Rainy Day My friend Kim and I embarked on a ride with a mission: to master the art of identifying gravel and off-road paths, embrace the thrill of these terrains, and dive headfirst into our newfound hobby. The sky had been weeping for quite some time, and despite my comprehensive waterproof gear, droplets were finding their way in. But Kim and I, seasoned riders through countless journeys, found solace in the rain.

item.title: Exploring the Woods and Dropping the Bike
item.description: Mind blowing realizations Wet stuff is slippery (WHAT!?) Good boots are important, your foot can get caught beneath 200kilos of bike (surprised pikachu face) 200kg is heavy (physics never seize to baffle me) Intro My girlfriend surprised me one day with an invitation to go mushroom picking. Now, I have to admit, I’m not particularly fond of mushrooms, and at that moment, the allure of staying in and being lazy was strong.
